channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024020529
item.description:
Report E-2024020529

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NRM experienced a UN1760 MCT 509 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 3’ x 53’ area of the trailer floor and a 5’ x 5’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and baking soda were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. All impacted absorbents, neutralizer, and PPE were then placed into a 35-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver came back with the package that was leaking. Package was given to the manager who notified Hazmat personnel. Hazmat was place in the hazmat cage under the hood for ventilation. DescribePack: Hole on inner DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was place in the hazmat cage under the hood for ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2024021102
item.description:
Report X-2024021102

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THIS MORNING THE PACKAGE CAME OUT THE TRAILER LEAKING FROM THE INSIDE OF THE BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SLAMMED ON THE ROLLERS CAUSING THE METHANOL BOTTLE TO UNSCREW AND SPILL DescribePack: DURING THE INSPECTION I NOTICED THAT THE BOTTLE CAP WAS LOOOSE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED HAZMAT WAS PLACED IN A SAFETY CONTAINER TO PREVENT OTHER PACKAGES FROM GETTING DAMAGED.
